results.text: You’re built for power, not for speed and you just need a moment to catch your breath—honest. For the next minute, you cannot use the Dash or Sprint actions.
You feel a muscle twinge in a way you know is going to go poorly. The amount of weight you can normally lift, drag, or push is halved until you take a long rest.
Back pain: We all get it. The number of bulky items you may carry on your person is reduced by –1 (to a maximum of 0). This lasts for the next 24 hours.
You try to plant your feet but it’s too little too late. You have disadvantage on your next check made to resist being knocked prone.

You fumble with what you are currently holding or carrying, causing you to drop the item. If the object is heavy or has the bulky property, you take [[/r 1d4]] points of bludgeoning damage as it falls onto your big toe.
You pushed yourself too hard and overextended yourself. You gain one level of Fatigue.
